news_items.content: Here is the rewritten version of the news with the requirements applied:
* Balcony collapse injures 3 of family in Chennai; Why power cuts in the city aren't always caused by TNPDCL's fault.
* Exhibition at Chennai's Lalit Kala Akademi showcases works of two retired art teachers.
Riverbank eviction drive resumes in Anakaputhur as authorities struggle to relocate residents from flood-prone areas.
Exhibition at Chennai's Lalit Kala Akademi highlights the artistic contributions of two retired art teachers.
Tanker lorries linked to BPCL's Ennore terminal go on strike due to disputes over working conditions and wages.
A man-made wall in Chennai city is being demolished as part of a drive to relocate residents from flood-prone areas.
Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M K Stalin demands resolution of the Katchatheevu issue and release of fishermen held captive by Tamil Nadu authorities.
Prime Minister ignoring Tamil Nadu's demand on issues related to the Katchatheevu region, leading to concerns over the prime minister's effectiveness in resolving regional conflicts.
Three Chennai college students drown while swimming in the Coimbatore River.
One kilogram of cocaine worth Rs 6 crore is seized in Chennai and eight people arrested in connection with a heroin trafficking case.
Monsoon rains bring early onset to Kerala; India views China as its primary adversary, Pakistan more as an 'ancillary' threat.
India's Chief of Defence Staff Anil Chauhan meets with BJP MLAs from Karnataka who have suspended their party following the meeting with Chief Minister Siddaramiah.
President Putin is criticized by Donald Trump for his response to the ongoing Ukraine conflict; Putin also denies any involvement in the conflict.
Karnataka: The BJP has revoked the suspension of several MP's after they met with Chief Minister Siddaramahia.
